SHORT_DESCR.P: Integrated Merlin operational support of the Merlin Fleet.
Integrated Merlin operational support of the Merlin Fleet.

D_JUSTIFICATION.P: The Merlin delivery team, part of the UK Ministry of Defence (the Authority), intends to amend contract No MERCL/1200, which the authority entered into with Leonardo MW Ltd (LMWL) on 10.2.2006, for the delivery of Integrated Operational Support (IOS) for the EH101 Merlin Aircraft Mk2, iMk3, Mk4 and Mk4A (the Contract). The amendment incorporates and gives effect to a firm price for the IOS performed during the 5-year pricing period commencing on 1.4.2020. The current value (Ex VAT) of the total Contract is 1 700 000 000 GBP and the estimated value of the subject matter of the amendment is 650 000 000 GBP (six hundred and fifty million pounds sterling).

It is considered that this amendment can be entered into by the authority using the negotiated procedure without publication of a contract notice, pursuant to Article 28(1)(e) of Directive 2009/81/EC (Regulation 16(1)(a)(ii) of the UK Defence and Security Public Contracts Regulations 2011 (SI 1848)) on the basis that the amendment may be awarded only to LMWL for technical reasons. LMWL alone has the specific know-how, tools and equipment and access to the technical drawings, publications and manufacturing data pertaining to the relevant aircraft and so alone can fulfil all the contractual requirements under the amendment with regard to the delivery of aircraft that can be safely operated within the scope of the Merlin safety case and airworthiness requirements. No other economic operator can therefore provide this IOS without access to such information and data.

INFO_ADD.P: The authority reserves the right to amend any condition related to security of information to reflect any changes in national law or government policy. If any contract documents are accompanied by instructions on safeguarding classified information (e.g. a security aspects letter), the authority reserves the right to amend the terms of these instructions to reflect any changes in national law or government policy, whether in respect of the applicable protective marking scheme, specific protective markings given, the aspects to which any protective marking applies, or otherwise.
